etymology.description: 杏 (apricot) + 仁 (kernel/seed) = apricot kernel → ‘almond’ in culinary usage.
etymology.interpretation: Literally “apricot kernel,” pointing to the edible seed inside an apricot pit; in common food contexts it often refers to almonds or almond-like kernels, though botanically almonds are 扁桃仁/巴旦木.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢喝杏仁露(我喜歡喝杏仁露)。
烘焙时常用杏仁粉(烘焙時常用杏仁粉)。
examples.pinyin: Hōngbèi shí cháng yòng xìngrén fěn.
examples.english: Almond flour is often used in baking.

examples.chinese: 这道甜品用的是南杏仁，不是苦杏仁(這道甜品用的是南杏仁，不是苦杏仁)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè dào tiánpǐn yòng de shì nán xìngrén, bù shì kǔ xìngrén.
examples.english: This dessert uses sweet apricot kernels, not bitter ones.
